Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not submit EBI information for quarter 3.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted EBI data for the third quarter. The operation set automatic calendar reminders to go off two days before the due dates to ensure the data is submitted timely. The operation emailed screen shots of the calendar to verify.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of three staff CPR certificates reviewed did not include the trainer's qualifications. The certificates also did not include the length of the training.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation to show the missing information on the training certificates.

Deficiency Narrative: Three staff files were reviewed, and one staff file did not include TB test results.
Correction Narrative: The staff completed a new TB test that includes the results. These documents were reviewed by RCCR Inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff's file contained reference checks that did not include all required information about the reference.
Correction Narrative: Agency Administrator emailed RCCR Inspector a copy of the staff's pre-employment reference check with the needed corrections on May 3, 2024.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection three fire extinguishers were observed to have expired in April 2024.
Correction Narrative: Agency sent pictures of the new fire extinguisher tags by email on May 6, 2024. RCCR Inspector reviewed fire extinguisher tags in the email to show they were in compliance. Further during the inspection on June 6, 2024, the fire extinguisher tags were observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The medication cabinet was unlocked during the inspection. Non-prescription ointments were stored in an unlocked cabinet that was accessible to children.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced follow-up inspection was conducted and the medication cabinet was locked. The ointments were observed to be locked in the Wellness Closet.

Deficiency Narrative: The operations did not have all documentation completed documentation was contractidcing on dates and information.
Correction Narrative: The operation has implemented internal audit process to ensure operation records are true and accurate.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the three child files that were reviewed did not document the date the preliminary service plan was completed.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their documentation and policies as per minimum standard.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was self administering an inhaler and there was no documentation.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their policy to allow children with medication to be admitted and the operation will follow all standards regarding self-administrating medication.

Deficiency Narrative: Child admission assessment did not have immunization record and other important information.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their documentation as per minimum standard.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation runaway log did not have information for the gender date of admiission or if law enfrocement was contacted.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their documentation as per minimum standard.

Deficiency Narrative: Van used to transport children did not have current liability insurance.
The operation  allowed a caregiver to have contact with the children in their admission assessment program prior to the caregiver having a TB screening completed.
Correction Narrative: Operation has developed a policy to ensure the operation stays in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two lighters were located in a drawer in the common living area.
The operation had designated a volunteer to be reponsible when the administrator was not at the facility.
Correction Narrative: Operation has hired staff that can occasionally handle administrators' responsibilities when the administrators is absent. A staff member will be at the facility daily (except Friday and Saturday). As children are admitted AT LAST! will begin to operate on a multiple shift schedule.
